reviews.text: Been a few years since I've been to Sammy's so I was excited and it was well worth it

If I could give my overall experience a negative number I would. My bill total was $86. I left 4 $20, a $5 and a $1. Waiter takes the money, comes back seconds later and informs me I only put 3 $20 bills. I informed him I counted the money twice and put the correct amount on the table. With inflation going on, I wasn‚Äôt willing to put another $20 bill down (it‚Äôs the principle). So I ask for the manager. I ask her if she can check the cameras and the first thing she says is ‚Äúthat‚Äôs not necessary.‚Äù (Then later on states that she doesn‚Äôt have access to the cameras). Then proceeds to tell me how long the waiter has been working there and how she has never had no issues with him. Let‚Äôs keep in mind, the word ‚Äústeal‚Äù or ‚Äústolen‚Äù hasn‚Äôt come out of my mouth. He could‚Äôve possibly misplaced it or it could‚Äôve fell on the floor on his way to the cash register. I came to Sammy‚Äôs Fish Box with my family, including my 3-year-old daughter. At first, my toddler was upset and crying‚Äîas toddlers often are‚Äîbut what shocked me was how the hostess handled it. She didn‚Äôt greet us warmly or even acknowledge us at first. After much encouragement, she finally made a very dismissive remark: ‚ÄúDo you even think you should sit down?‚Äù That comment alone was unprofessional and insensitive. Once we were seated, things didn‚Äôt improve. The hostess (late 30‚Äôs-40, female, black hair) continued to be inattentive and showed no concern for our table. I even decided to step outside and take my daughter to the park, leaving my husband and mother at the restaurant, but even then the hostess never bothered to check on them or make sure they were being taken care of.

For a restaurant that caters to families and large groups, I expected kindness, patience, and at least basic attentiveness. Instead, the service we received‚Äîespecially from the hostess‚Äîwas cold, dismissive, and frankly terrible. It left such a bad impression that I would not return, and I cannot recommend this restaurant to other families.

Enjoyed the night out, food was good, staff accommodating, and pleasant, it was worth my 54 miles  round trip.
The food and drinks were amazing.

I'm writing this review to whoever bought this place and manages it now. Real long time Sammy customers will agree with me. I have been coming here for close to 18 years and to see the short cuts, changed menu and slow service is really sad. I'm sure the original owner would've been sad to see this. The menu is completely different now. Your not served the pickled appetizers or the big bread with cheese anymore. Everything that used to come with meals is charged as a side order salad, corn so on so on. Your not served pasta anymore and the pilaf rice is much smaller on the platter even the butter, sour cream are skimped... Very disappointed and unfortunately I won't be returning here. I'm not going to pay over 100$ for a experience that once was when we used to have plentiful. Bye Sammy's

09/01/2024 - First time visiting Sammy‚Äôs Shrimp Box in City Island, NY with family and friends. Semi-whimsical decor yet true to its brand. Comfortable seating either indoors or in their outdoor patio. Depending where you sit you may get a glimpse of the Bronx River. I also ordered a Margarita which was ok, and a Coca ColaZ Our server Santos was comical. Thank you for your service. Their complimentary offering is a meal itself consisting of various flavored breads, vegetables, and a thick slice of cheddar cheese. Cool crowd and cool spot for various occasions. They have a valet /parking lot across the street from the restaurant. Decent prices.

Where do I begin?!!  This is hands down the best seafood restaurant in city island!! Once you‚Äôre seated, they bring you delicious bread and the most amazing cornbread with a piece of cheddar cheese!! The calamari was delicious, along with the Sam trio. The fried shrimp and the onion rings (which came with the steak and shrimp combo) were also very good! The waiter also brought over rice and corn on the cob with our meals (which we didn‚Äôt order, nor do I think our meals came with it). The only downfall is it‚Äôs very expensive here. One beer was over $8.00 and the seafood platter was about $75.00. However, the food was honestly so delicious and the service was AMAZING! It was definitely worth it. There is no need to try any other seafood restaurant because this is the best in City Island!

Sammy's was my original dinner date spot when I first ventured this way and almost a decade plus later they remain consistently Legendary from the Valet to paying the check. Beware , you will eat mass quantities of food here and likely have more than enough to take home. Ask for Julian for the ideal waiter. Sammy's waiters are great but Jukisn is Iconic.  He has been my special request for years,  sometimes hes not on schedule when I'm there but when he is the dining experience is greatly magnified. Julian is friendly polite and will make any accommodation to a food order to please you, he checks on you frequently and will keep you coming back . Now the food is hot delicious fresh and well seasoned. Broiled Red Snapper stuffed with crabmeat , Bang Bang Shrimp Appetizer and strawberry shortcake for dessert with have you feeling like upur in Heaven. Fried Calamar is Sinfully Delicious . They have excellent surf and turf combos and Paella . Fresh housemade bread and cornbread served within 1 minute of being seated. Salad served before dinner. Valets will take good care of your vehicle they will not abuse your sports car. They work for tips so take care of them , they are good kids . If you are looking for a warm welcoming environment with delicious food and comfy seating , give Sammy's Shrimp Box a go you will not be disappointed.
